Description: Scarab made of glazed steatite, small part at the base is chipped of. The glaze shows a whitish-beige colour. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single thin line. The division between prothorax and elytra is shown by a small indent at the sides. No suture visible, two cracks on the back though. The head is shown with a single line, both eyes indicated by small raised areas. The clypeus is clearly indicated, one thick groove close to the eyes, five small lines at the other end. The plates at each side are clearly visible as well, each subdivided by a small groove into two parts. The side of the scarab shows all three legs with hairs indicated by small grooves, the scarab is sitting on top of a base plate. The seal at the base shows a cartouche in the middle with (Mn-kheper-Ra)|, left and right of it an uraeus facing the cartouche. The longitudinal perforation is fully preserved.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 24)
